text: Tomb of Abdossamad at the Jameh Mosque of Natanz, built in 1304CE. Sheikh Abdussamad Esfahani, (), also spelled Abdul Samad, 'Abd al-Samad, or Abd-ul- Samad, was a famous Ilkhanid era Shi'ite Sufi of the 13th century. After Abdussamad's death in 1299 CE, his disciple, the Ilkhanid vizier Zayn al-Din Mastaria, built a in Natanz in his honor. The congregational (Jameh) mosque of Natanz was built around the tomb. ==External links== *Archnet entry * *Shrine Complex of Shaykh 'Abd al-Samad *The Sheikh Abdolsamad Mosque in Natanz Iran *Square Kufic script on the Sheikh Abd al-Samad shrine complex Category:Iranian Sufis Category:1299 deaths Category:Year of birth unknown
